message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.DB, cs.PL, cs.SE 

This paper deals with the interaction between rules and ontologies in the Semantic Web, which is a topic that falls under the categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI), logic (cs.LO), databases (cs.DB), programming languages (cs.PL), and software engineering (cs.SE). The paper specifically discusses the use of Prolog as a tool for automated reasoning on ontologies and rules, which is a technique commonly used in the logic programming community (cs.PL). However, the paper also addresses issues related to knowledge representation and reasoning, which are relevant to the AI and database communities (cs.AI and cs.DB). Finally, the paper discusses techniques for optimizing the performance of the system, which is a topic of interest to the software engineering community (cs.SE).
